intro: Asplundia brunneistigma, commonly known as the brown-stigma asplundia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyclanthaceae. It is native to Central and South America, particularly found in tropical regions with humid climates. The plant features a short, thick rhizome and produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a rough, waxy texture. Asplundia brunneistigma is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements.
